p: The production of oil suitable for food consumption requires the removal of undesired compounds that may affect consumer acceptability (e.g., smelly or colored substances) and sometimes be toxic (e.g., heavy metals, dioxins, or polychlorinated biphenyls) [ 50, 51]. Steps that are usually included are the following: degumming, neutralization, bleaching, and deodorization [ 60, 64].
